skill.name: browser-use
skill.description: Browser automation using Playwright MCP. Navigate websites, fill forms, click elements, take screenshots, and extract data. Use when tasks require web browsing, form submission, web scraping, UI testing, or any browser interaction.
skill.summary: Browser automation using Playwright MCP. Navigate websites, fill forms, click elements, take screens...
skill.author: AbdullahMalik17

security_audit.summary: This is legitimate browser automation software using Playwright MCP. Static findings are primarily false positives: markdown documentation examples are flagged as shell execution, JSON Schema URIs are misidentified as weak cryptography, and subprocess.Popen is legitimate MCP server connection logic. No evidence of malicious intent or data exfiltration.

content.value_statement: Automate web browsing tasks like form filling, data extraction, and UI testing through Playwright MCP server. This skill provides Claude Code with browser automation capabilities for any web-based workflow.
actual_capabilities: Navigate to URLs and manage browser history
Fill forms and interact with web page elements
Take screenshots and extract page content
Wait for elements or conditions before proceeding
limitations: Requires Playwright MCP server running locally
Cannot automate browsers behind authentication without credentials
Limited to single browser tab unless explicitly multi-tab
JavaScript execution depends on page security policies

use_cases.title: Test web applications
use_cases.description: Automate UI testing by navigating pages, filling forms, and verifying page content.

use_cases.title: Extract web data
use_cases.description: Scrape structured data from websites by combining navigation, snapshots, and JavaScript evaluation.

use_cases.title: Fill web forms
use_cases.description: Automate form submissions across multiple pages for content publishing workflows.

prompt_templates.title: Navigate and search
prompt_templates.prompt: Go to {url}, search for {search_term}, and tell me what you find.

prompt_templates.title: Fill a form
prompt_templates.scenario: Submit data to a web form
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to {url}, fill in the form fields with: {field_data}, submit it, and confirm the result.

prompt_templates.title: Extract structured data
prompt_templates.prompt: Go to {url}, get a snapshot of the page, and extract all {data_type} into a structured format.

prompt_templates.title: End-to-end workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Complete this workflow: 1) Navigate to {start_url}, 2) {step2}, 3) {step3}, 4) Take a screenshot of the final page.

output_examples.input: Go to example.com and tell me the page title
output: Page structure: Simple page with heading and description

output_examples.input: Fill the login form at example.com with user=test

best_practices: Start the Playwright MCP server once and reuse it for multiple browser tasks
Use browser_snapshot to get element references before clicking or typing
Take screenshots after completing critical steps to verify outcomes
Stop the server when browser work is complete to free system resources
anti_patterns: Calling browser_close between related steps (loses page state)
Not waiting for elements to load before interacting
Running multiple browser instances instead of using shared context
Automating without verifying results through snapshots or screenshots

faq.question: How do I start the browser server?
faq.answer: Run 'bash scripts/start-server.sh' to start Playwright MCP on port 8808.

faq.question: Can I automate multiple tabs?
faq.description: The skill uses shared browser context by default for maintaining state across calls.

faq.question: What if an element is not found?
faq.answer: Run browser_snapshot first to get current element references before interacting.

faq.question: Does this work with JavaScript-heavy sites?
faq.answer: Yes, browser_evaluate can run custom JavaScript in page context.

faq.question: How do I stop the server?
faq.answer: Run 'bash scripts/stop-server.sh' to gracefully close the browser and stop the server.

faq.question: Can I take full page screenshots?
faq.answer: Yes, use browser_take_screenshot with fullPage:true for complete page capture.
